instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 CPU temp while upgrading
threads.message:
I have a fully working Early 2015 820-00165 running MAC OS high Sierra

When I boot from my USB installer drive in an attempt to upgrade to Catalina I have noted that the CPU gets hot
Fan spinning but this CPU is hot

The install does not appear to be hanging but I started to get alarmed at how how this CPU was getting during an install so I just have not done the upgrade (completed the install/upgrade of Catalina)

Just to be safe I took informaticos advice and made sure that I have a full BIOS backup to my MEDUSA (and file on my PC) before doing this.

Is this normal behavior?
Honestly I have never put  my thumb on the CPU during up an install/upgrade in the past so this may be totally normal behavior but I needed an opinion.

The system passes the onboard diagnostics completely.

threads.title: 820-00165 CPU temp while upgrading
threads.message:
Run HWMonitor and check CPU temps in normal use, or playing YouTube.

I never did such "touching test" on the install process.
Could be problem with thermal paste, heatpipe, or just normal behaviour.

threads.title: 820-00165 CPU temp while upgrading
threads.message:
Yeah temps are normal at idle 42
New heatpipe

47 playing youtube

looks good

threads.title: 820-00165 CPU temp while upgrading
threads.message: They can easily go past 90°C under load so burning your finger on the heatpipe isn't suprising. CPU will throttle down at 105°C to try to keep temperature below that point, and platform will shutdown if temperature keeps rising.
